body_html:
Oops, the original post of that issue made me think that it was about "within" process memory. As identified there, upgrading the nvidia driver (to 367.27) on my Titan X machine and on the EC2 instance fixed the problem. No more kernel space leak. Thank you!

And thank you all for your hard work on TensorFlow! It is an excellent library.

And thank you all for your hard work on TensorFlow! It is an excellent library.
body:
Oops, the original post of that issue made me think that it was about "within" process memory. As identified there, upgrading the nvidia driver (to 367.27) on my Titan X machine and on the EC2 instance fixed the problem. No more kernel space leak. Thank you!

And thank you all for your hard work on TensorFlow! It is an excellent library.
